message: How many fellow attendees are interested in a visualization BoF?  2D, 3D, realtime, scientific, statistical, infographics, etc. etc.
I am.  Have played around a little with matplotlib, but most of my display is web-based, so looking into HighCharts.  Interested also in how to best deliver data to web-based visualization.
me too...  @EricFloehr looking into auto-generating HighCharts graphs with Python, a bit tricky but would be cool to see if anyone got clever ideas
I would be interested in this if I have time. I may not have time, though - my time at PyCon is pretty heavily booked.
@jamespaxi What's tricky about it?
@pwang just many ways to do it
or at least more manageable ways to use matplotlib :)
I'd love to attend a BoF on this, actually. So many options available, I'd be glad to see what other people are doing in this area.
I'm using matplotlib with django to create some 2d graphs. I'd be interested in this BoF, so I'll keep an eye out for it.
I'm interested. I'd love to hear if there's a better way than matplotlib
I'm interested too.

Has anyone used Protovis? (http://vis.stanford.edu/protovis)  There's a ToscaWidgets wrapper for it at http://pypi.python.org/pypi/tw2.protovis.hierarchies/0.1.a1, and someone on the Protovis mailing list mentioned having done a Python version of it...
i've played around a bit with protovis, but nothing integrated with server-side code yet
i really like protovis overall though, it's easily my favorite of the viz tools i've used for the web
curious, if there is a get together..

Well let's definitely have a get-together, since it seems like there's enough interest.  Even if it's just a few people showcasing what they've got, that would be fun.  I suspect once I post something on the physical BoF board, a lot more people will show.
@pwang  Provotis is most excellent. Thanks.  I too am interested in visualization.
I'm interested in a openspace/bof for this topic. Hard part of course is finding the time that doesn't overlap other topics I'm interested in.
I am very very interested in it.  I am especially interested in experiences on parallel visualization.
I'm Don Spaulding, and I approve this BoF.
Count me in for this BoF!
OK, I just reserved us a space for 9pm on Saturday.  If this is a really bad time for lots of people, we can extend the time, but please pipe up early before the BoF board fills up!
@pwang PyCon noob here... where is the BoF board and where do we go?
@dtran openspace boards are by the hanover meetings rooms
i'm in no matter when it happens
@pwang How about Friday night? Saturday is testing, which might be very popular and hard to compete with.
@pwang Awesome - just added myself
OK, I have added a page on the conference wiki: http://us.pycon.org/2011/openspaces/Visualization/
Great, see you there!

Hey guys, per our discussion in the hallway after the BoF, I have created a new Convore group, "Python Scientific Computing": https://convore.com/python-scientific-computing/  Please join up  and we can continue the discussion!
